title: Embassy of Indonesia, Prague
text: The Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia in Prague (; ) is the diplomatic mission of the <a href="Republic%20of%20Indonesia">Republic of Indonesia</a> to the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. The embassy was originally Indonesia's diplomatic mission to <a href="Czechoslovakia">Czechoslovakia</a>. After the country's <a href="Velvet%20Divorce">split</a> into the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a> and <a href="Slovakia">Slovakia</a>, the embassy became the diplomatic mission for the former. The first Indonesia ambassador to Czechoslovakia was Rudolf Alexander Asmaun in 1957. The current ambassador to the Czech Republic is Kenssy Dwi Ekaningsih who was appointed by <a href="President%20of%20Indonesia">President</a> <a href="Joko%20Widodo">Joko Widodo</a> on 13 February 2019.
